title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 4 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: x factor star knocked out by loft ladder .
'death risk ' led to christmas tree cordon .
cycle lane to be moved after complaints .
beer festival to move to arena .

documents.title: manchester united 2-0 derby county
text: manchester united 2-0 derby county
author: Emlyn Begley
BBC Sport

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's updates have come to an end .
live coverage will begin again at 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: weather : warning remains in place for wind
text: the met office 's yellow weather warning for wind remains in place this evening .
however the wind will begin to ease and it will be dry with clear spells with some outbreaks of rain .
it will be a cloudy start tomorrow with some rain but it will become drier and brighter during the afternoon .
a few showers still possible but starting to feel colder with maximum temperatures of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: metal sheet blown off building
text: emergency services are in derby city centre after a dangerous large metal sheet blew loose from a building .
derbyshire police and derbyshire fire and rescue service were called to east street shortly before 3.30pm today .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: ambulance patients ' wait times 'double '
text: there 's been a sharp rise in the number of ambulances being delayed outside hospitals , according to performance figures from nhs england .
between christmas day and new year 's eve , 178 crews in leicester were delayed by more than an hour and 182 waited between 30 and 60 minutes .
in nottingham , 81 patients waited between 30 and 60 minutes while just four waited more than an hour .
but 233 patients at king 's mill hospital in sutton-in-ashfield waited 30 to 60 minutes and 41 waited more than an hour .
in derby , 152 patients waited between 30 and 60 minutes and just six people waited more than 60 minutes .
the handover of patients should n't take longer than 15 minutes according to nhs targets but at king 's mill between christmas day and new year 's eve 43 % of handovers took more than 30 minutes .
richard henderson , chief executive of emas said : `` it has been a challenging time but we 've delivered the best possible service with the resources available to us . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: photo appeal after christmas display destroyed
text: police have shared cctv images in a bid to catch vandals who damaged a christmas display in chesterfield town centre .
a sleigh with three elves and a reindeer was destroyed at the vicar lane shopping centre just before 23:00 on 21 december .
they 've asked anyone who recognises themselves or someone they know in the images to call 101 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: plans for new £ 5m lidl rejected by council
text: plans to open a new multi-million pound lidl store in sutton-in-ashfield have been rejected .
the budget grocery chain wanted to open a store on a two-and-a-half acre former pretty polly factory site in mansfield road .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: derby is 'third fastest growing uk city '
text: derby is the third fastest growing city in the uk , according to a new report .

the research by an economic consultancy says the weak pound at the end of 2017 boosted manufacturing exporters in the city like toyota and rolls-royce - with only cambridge and aberdeen 's economies growing more quickly .
leicester and nottingham placed 33rd and 34th in the rankings respectively .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: rape accused 'took advantage of damsel in distress '
text: a 29-year-old man took advantage of a damsel in distress '' and raped her in her derby home , a court has been told .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: bag of dead hares discovered by dog walker
text: the rspca has described the discovery of a bag containing nine dead hares as `` horrific '' .
the leicester mercury reported the gruesome discovery was made by a dog walker on a road in swannington yesterday morning .
a spokeswoman for the charity said : `` this must have been a horrific find for the person who came across the bodies which had been dumped in a large bag . ''
she added that as hunting hares was not illegal with the landowner 's permission , the rspca would not be taking the matter further .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: final weekend for jubilee square ice rink
text: ticket sales for the christmas ice rink in leicester 's jubilee square have hit the 22,000 mark .
the attraction is due to close at 20:00 on monday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: beer festival to move to arena
text: the campaign for real ale has confirmed that the robin hood beer and cider festival will be held at the nottingham arena for the next three years .
it is moving venues during a major redevelopment of its regular home at nottingham castle .
the event will run from 17 to 20 october .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: 'death risk ' led to christmas tree cordon
text: 'death risk ' led to christmas tree cordon

documents.title: appeal after 'man flashes at teenager '
text: officers are appealing for witnesses after a man exposed himself to a 17-year-old girl in bingham .
nottinghamshire police said it happened outside the chesterfield pub in church street at about 09:40 on 30 december .
the man , who was in his 40s or 50s , is described as white , 5ft 5in tall , of slim build , with untidy grey hair .
he had a `` scruffy appearance '' and a noteable gap between his front teeth and a chipped tooth .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : double rainbow in derby
text: derby was treated to a magnificent double rainbow this afternoon - and our weather watchers were on hand to capture it .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: photo released of man killed in clay cross crash
text: the family of a 74-year-old man who died after being hit by a car in clay cross earlier this week have shared a photo of him .
alan roberts , from north wingfield , was struck by a mazda mx-5 while crossing high street on tuesday evening .
the car stopped after the crash but no arrests were made .
police have appealed for witnesses and dashcam footage .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: tram tracks cleared but delays remain
text: it might take you slightly longer to get home this evening
update : the ambulance has now cleared the tracks and all services are running to all stops .
we have delays to service up to 30 minutes and our control room will do all they can to reform service .
we thank you all for your patience and understanding this afternoon .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'medical emergency ' blocks tram tracks
text: the emergency is also causing disruption to bus services in that area .
disruption to service : we currently have a medical emergency on the tracks at old market square .
there will be no tram service between royal centre and old market square .
emergency service are on site and we will update of any changes .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: leicester nursery saved from closure
text: a nursery in leicester has been saved after the city council decided to rethink its braunstone leisure centre extension .
leicester city council had planned to convert a space leased by sunflowers nursery into a new dance and fitness suite .
it could have led to the nursery closing for good but following a consultation , the authority will allow them to continue to rent the space .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: boots reports sales drop after 'challenging ' period
text: boots ' parent company says retail sales in its uk stores fell by 1.4 % in the three months to december - describing the market as `` challenging '' .
globally , sales for walgreens boots alliance rose by almost 8 % but quarterly profits were badly hit because of costs associated with investing in a pharmacy company in china .
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: puel : mahrez 'happy ' at leicester city
text: claude puel has spoken about riyad mahrez 's future at leicester city .
the foxes boss said : `` riyad is a valuable player in this team .
when i have discussed with him , he 's enjoying his football .
he 's a happy player .
this is a good thing . ''
when asked if the winger had expressed desire to leave the club , puel said : no .
he 's told me he is happy . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man , 74 , dies after being hit by car
text: an elderly man who was seriously injured after being hit by a car in clay cross has died .
alan roberts , 74 , was crossing high street when he was hit by a grey mazda mx-5 , which was travelling towards alfreton , derbyshire police said .
mr roberts , of north wingfield , was taken to northern general hospital but has now died .
it happened at about 18:40 on 2 january .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: basketball : injured thomson expecting call up
text: leicester riders forward , andy thomson has confirmed to bbc leicester that he is currently playing through an injury , but it wo n't hinder his performances .
head coach , rob paternostro has been resting the 33-year-old over a busy festive period but may need to call on him during the double-game weekend ahead .
the riders travel to the plymouth raiders tomorrow night in the quarter finals of the bbl trophy , before hosting worcester wolves just 24 hours later at the leicester sports arena .
author: Owynn Atkin
BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: man dies in hospital after new year 's eve party collapse
text: a man taken ill at a new year 's eve event in leicester has died .
the 32-year-old man collapsed at the one big new year 's eve event at the o2 academy in the percy gee building on the leicester university campus .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: man robbed and attacked near railway station
text: a 21-year-old man suffered facial injuries when he was attacked and robbed near peatree railway station in derby .
police said the man had two phones stolen after being knocked to the ground by three men while walking home from mcdonald 's in osmaston park road on tuesday night .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : gary rowett on man utd
text: derby county manager gary rowett says tomorrow night 's fa cup game at manchester united will be a good test of his side 's premier league aspirations .
the rams come into the third round clash at old trafford on the back of a seven-game unbeaten run that has seen them rise to second in the championship .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: '400 nurses needed ' to plug shortage in leicester
text: about 400 additional nurses are needed to plug a shortage in leicester 's three hospitals , according to a senior nurse .
the nursing vacancy rate is just under 10 % at the hospitals , which means temporary staff are being employed to meet targets and some nurses are working extra shifts .
maria mcauley , assistant chief nurse , said : `` if you think of how many wards we have , it feels we are short of a lot of nurses but in comparison to other nhs organisations it is not .
`` obviously we would like to have no vacancies whatsoever in leicester hospitals hence why we are doing the recruitment day next weekend on 13 january . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: post office staff threatened with crowbar
text: a man used a crowbar to threaten staff before taking cigarettes during a robbery at a post office .
nottinghamshire police said the man took a `` large amount of cigarettes '' before fleeing .
the man was described as white and was wearing a face covering and a dark-coloured hooded top .
it happened on forest road , annesley woodhouse , at about 06:40 yesterday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: x factor star knocked out by loft ladder
text: x factor star knocked out by loft ladder

documents.title: messages of support for ill ex-rugby player
text: stars from the world of rugby have shown their support for former player and charity campaigner matt hampson , who was admitted to hospital over christmas .
mr hampson , a former leicester tigers player , who was forced to retire from rugby in 2005 after an accident in training , has been suffering from pancreatitis .
roy jackson , from mr hampson 's charity , said on wednesday : `` matt 's problem is he does n't feel any pain but he is getting there , they are dealing with and sorting out his illness . ''
thinking of you @ twitterid quick recovery mate
get well soon
just heard the news that @ twitterid has n't been well over christmas .
get well soon pal !
get well soon to someone who inspires all !
@ twitterid - one lovely genuine bloke !
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: x-factor singer 'determined ' to get back on stage
text: singer sam bailey said she is `` determined '' to get back on the pantomime stage after being knocked out by a loft ladder at her home .
the 40-year-old was taken to hospital by ambulance with concussion after she was injured retrieving a suitcase on tuesday .
martin ballard , a bbc radio leicester presenter and the dame in the pantomime , said the cast were `` shocked '' to hear the news .
he said : `` sam 's singing is irreplaceable and she drives the whole story .
`` her understudy , mae grocock , had to go on at extremely short notice and has done a fantastic job .
`` we are all missing sam and would love to have her back , but we also do n't want her to rush back too early . ''
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'risk of death ' prompted 'embarrassing ' tree cordon
text: remember the furore around the city council 's decision to place an extensive cordon around derby 's market place christmas tree in november ?
the barrier prompted much ridicule and was soon scaled down after the authority concluded its approach had been `` over cautious '' .
today , in response to a freedom of information request , the authority has published the risk assessment it carried out before putting the original cordon in place .

the assessment had concluded the 35ft tree posed a `` likely risk '' of `` multiple major injury or fatality '' if it fell over and such an event would `` potentially leave the authority exposed to criticism '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: open letter over homeless concerns
text: a chief executive from a nottingham art charity has written an open letter raising concerns about help for the homeless .
dr nick owen from the mighty creatives said he tried to find accommodation for a man on boxing day but was turned away repeatedly .
it comes despite claims from nottingham city council that `` no-one need sleep rough in nottingham this winter '' .
dr owen said : `` you would like to think there might be spaces somewhere to get into a room for a couple of hours to sleep and get a cup of tea wandering the streets is n't an answer . ''

nottingham city council said it ca n't comment on individual cases but help and support is offered to everyone sleeping rough , but some reject it or are thrown out of shelters for violence or substance misuse .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: police seek permission for archives building
text: a planning committee will today decide whether or not to give leicestershire police permission to build a new storage building at its headquarters .
if approved , the proposals would see police equipment and archive material from across the county stored at a single site in enderby .
the scheme is recommended for approval by blaby district council .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: power back on in oakham
text: oakham is fully electrified once again - the power cut had affected more than 700 properties .
power is now restored in the # oakham # le15 areas .
we are sorry for any problems caused by the # powercut this morning , rod .
we have use again 3min # powercut # uppingham # oakham # rutland on 11:25 +- are this the last # powercut and work it now oke ?
and thanks again for fast # service
hello , sorry about that happening .
all supplies have been restored , engineers are still working on the network , but power should n't be interrupted again , rod .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: lane remains closed on m1
text: one lane remains closed on the m1 northbound between junctions 23a and 24 for kegworth following a crash .
# m1 northbound between j23a and j24 # kegworth we have 1 lane closed through the roadworks due to a collision involving a car .
minimal delays on the approach at this time .
morning !
i 'm from the derby telegraph .
mind if we share this thanks !
- hi chris yes you can use the can you just credit us please .
thanks !
someone thinking it was a ramp for a new a-team series
will the driver be reported to the police ?
i 'll report her , do n't worry
@ twitterid - something to make you laugh or cry .
being rwd he could potentially pop that right back down that slope
i 'm afraid that it was a she and it took three hours to remove off the armco barrier .
argh , presumption three hours ?
they were clearly on a good hourly rate then .
i 'd guess crouch recovery dealt with this one .
hope his electricity has n't spilled out all over the carriageway !
i 'm guessing , someone was not paying attention and tried to make a last minute exit
that 's correct
this # muppet was clearly # drivingwithoutduecareandattention
can we stop letting idiots drive yet ?
ty bmw drivers
is it a charging point ?
could n't have parked it much better myself
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: shops blame pedestrianisation for lost trade
text: leicestershire county council says it will address the concerns of independent shops in loughborough who say they 've been struggling financially since the town centre was pedestrianised .
some businesses say they have n't recovered since the new measures were introduced .
other issues raised by shopkeepers included high rates of crime and a lack of free parking .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: donations give women 's charity reprieve
text: a charity which works with vulnerable women in derby , says public support has helped save it from closure .
derby women 's centre had to make all of its staff redundant earlier this year due to a funding shortage .
but public donations have allowed it to remain open until at least march and staff say they 're delighted the centre can continue to save lives .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: derby hospital bed occupancy levels exceed 'safe ' limit
text: the latest winter situation report from the trust that runs the royal derby hospital and london road community hospital shows bed occupancy rose to 92.3 % at new year - the recommended 'safe ' limit is 85 % .
the national average for the week leading up to new year 's eve was 91.7 % .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: lane closed on m1 after crash
text: this is the current scene on the m1 northbound between j23a and j24 where a lane has been closed following a crash .
it appears the closure is n't causing any major delays .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: hundreds of homes without power in oakham
text: more than 700 properties have been hit by a power cut in the oakham area .
western power distribution said it hoped to have supplies restored by 11:00 .
we are sorry about the # powercut in the # oakham # le15 areas .
engineers are working on this and aim to have all properties back on by 11:00 , rod .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cathedral quarter traders want parking improvements
text: traders have urged the city council to improve parking in a busy part of derby .
research carried out by business leaders in the cathedral quarter has found many traders and visitors feel charges are too high and there are n't enough spaces .
the city council , which is involved in the research , says it will not be commenting until the review is complete .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham panthers semi-finals victory
text: nottingham panthers are into the challenge cup semi-finals after a 7-4 aggregate victory over milton keynes lightning .
panthers won their quarter-final second leg 6-2 at the national ice centre last night , including a burst of three goals in 87 seconds in the second period .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: shop to display war exhibition
text: an exhibition celebrating the 50 men from coalville who fought in world war one is to remain on display .
dozens of life sized cardboard cut-outs were created by local schools and businesses last year as part of the hero project .
the exhibition has now ended but the local co-op has stepped in and is providing a new home for the artwork .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: x factor star sam bailey knocked out by loft ladder
text: singer sam bailey is recovering after being knocked out by a loft ladder at her home in leicester .
the x factor star was taken to hospital with concussion after the accident happened while she was retrieving a suitcase at the weekend .
bailey , who 's currently appearing in panto at leicester 's de montfort hall , later tweeted to say she was `` on the mend '' and was `` determined to get back on that stage '' .
i 'm on the mend people !
argh hope your better soon chloe and david going to watch the panto tonight
i know !
i 'm gutted
your health comes first sam xx i hope you 're okay hun get well soon love u loads xx
everyone at @ twitterid wishes you a speedy recovery and hope to see you soon < 3 xx
very pleased to hear that
what the heck happened ? ? ! !
rest up soldier xx
get better soon
get well soon sam
sadly , it was more important to make sure there were photos of her on the gurney .
insensitive .
the power of social media at its best .
good grief sam , get well soon # expo
i 'm going to panto tomorrow do n't suppose i will see u now get well soon sam xx
glad your on the mend huntake it easy & get plenty of rest xxx
hope your okay
just rest up babe , and take it easy !
i know it 's hard when your a mum , but please do n't rush back into your routine , and ask for help do n't struggle alone !
love the pug , hope all is well
lmg what happened to you
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: operations cancelled as hospitals struggle to cope
text: the trust that runs nottingham 's two main hospitals has confirmed it 's cancelling operations and outpatient clinics this week .
the nuh trust says an increase in respiratory illnesses and frail elderly attendances have put the qmc and city hospitals under immense pressure .
it 's cancelled 58 routine operations and seven outpatients clinics after nhs england urged hospitals to consider the move to manage winter pressures .
hundreds of non-urgent operations have also been postponed at hospitals in leicester and derby for the same reason .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: council to tackle work-related stress
text: a new way to tackle work days lost to stress will be tried at nottinghamshire county council .
the authority is introducing the buddy network scheme which involves pairing workers who would return from being off sick for a long time with a colleague who would provide support .
the scheme would also help women returning after maternity leave .
nationally 22.2 % of sick leave in local government is because of work-related stress but nottinghamshire 's rate is lower at 17.7 % .
the authority says it wants to reduce this figure further .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: market reopens after storm closure
text: derby 's market hall has reopened this morning after being closed yesterday as a precaution during high winds .
the city council ordered the closure due to concerns about glass panels in the building 's roof .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: cycle lane to be moved after complaints
text: a cycle path is to be moved from one side of a road to the other just a year after being installed - provoking anger from some road users .
the route was installed by nottingham city council in 2016 as part of wider traffic management in the lenton area .
however , some abbey street residents complained it had caused problems by taking away on-street parking .
plans for three months of roadworks to move the lane have been called `` mad '' and `` absolutely disgraceful '' .
the council has now admitted this caused parking issues in surrounding streets and will remove one of the single paths and expand the one opposite into a two-way cycle lane .

the authority said it had carried out an extensive consultation on the original scheme and the route had seen a 15 % rise in cycle journeys but it was `` impossible to predict '' exactly how road users would `` use the space '' .
work will begin on 15 january and is due to last 12 weeks .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: latest on the roads
text: rejoice - it appears there are no major problems on roads in our region at the moment , although if you 're heading north on the m1 , there are slight delays between j32 and j33 because of a broken-down vehicle .
# m1 southbound between j33 and j32 - broken down vehicle - full details at ( updated every 5 minutes )
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's your forecast for the day ahead .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or contact us via facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News
